Im not sure if this is ur first child but if it isnt and u have a history of complications.  But they will do one early. Based on how mucg weight u have gained. Symptoms u may have told him about that may have worried him.   141 isnt really high.  140 is usually the cut off.

my dr sent me at 28 weeks , at 8.5 weeks its too early to do this. i did not pass the 1 hour and they sent me for the 3 hours, maybe u should get a second openion from other doctor , u can change ur doctor , its early now , if u are not happy with her/ him change it befor betoo late.

Well i wouldnt run and change Drs right away, the reason i asked if you had already had previous bloodwork done was because if you had they might have already checked what your sugar was at the time and if you have had your urine checked it may have already shown a amall amount of sugar, or just that he may be considering you high risk for it from possible family hystory, weight, ect.If the result are normal i would assume you would still have the routine 24-28 week glucose check done again...Drs dont just do this for fun, its usually with their clients best interest for their safety... so there must be something that flagged him to test earlier... which for certain reasons does happen...talk to him and ask questions...

a blood glucose test is normal when you first see the doctor around 8 to 10 weeks if your doctor thinks you have a risk factors for gestational diabetes such as being overweight. I am overweight and the doctor does 1 for me at 8 weeks and then again later on at the normal time. also your number could have been high if you didn't fast the night before.
